Description: A letter written in 11 vertical lines (recto), with an address on the verso. The letter is reused, ll. 2-7 being in the hand of the original scribe, and 1, 8-11 in the hand of the second.
Curator's comments: James, T. G. H., The Hekanakhte papers : and other early Middle Kingdom documents, 94-97, pls. 27-28. The letter is also referred to as 'Gardiner's letter'.
Bibliographic references: James 1962 / The Hekanakhte papers, and other early Middle Kingdom documents (94-97; pl.27-28)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381271) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381271)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, bleached, brittle, fractured Black ink (smudged) Tabbed: silk Displayed in Room 63 until 1997 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: fragmentary: bottom right corner lost, lacunae in the centre, and bottom edge lost.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alan Henderson Gardiner
